name: Tethne
tagline: Python module for working with Web of Science data
body:
### Tethne
Tethne is a Python module for working with Web of Science data, currently under development by the [ASU Digital Innovation Group](http://devo-evo.lab.asu.edu/diging). To start using Tethne, download and install it:

```
$ git clone https://github.com/diging/tethne.git
$ cd tethne
$ python setup.py install
```

You can then import Tethne as you would any other module. We recommend the following namespace conventions:

```python
>>> import tethne.readers as rd
>>> import tethne.networks as nt
>>> import tethne.analysis as an
>>> import tethne.writers as wr
```

### API Documentation
Documentation for Tethne is a work in progress, as is the software itself. You can find the most recent build of our documentation [here](http://diging.github.io/tethne/api).

### Contributors
Tethne is developed by the Digital Innovation Group (@diging), and was initially developed by Erick Peirson (@erickpeirson). Aaron Baker (@aabaker99) made some major structural improvements, and Ramki Subramanian (@rsubra13) is working on adding functionality.

### Support or Contact
Open a [new issue](https://github.com/diging/tethne/issues), or contact Erick (@erickpeirson).

### Disclosure
This material is based upon work supported by the National Science Foundation GraduateÂ Research Fellowship Program under Grant No. 2011131209, and NSF Doctoral Dissertation Research Improvement Grant No. 1256752.
